'''Isumbras Took III''' was the twenty-third [[Thain]] of [[the Shire]], the eleventh of the [[Took Family]].

==History==
Isumbras was the son of [[Isengrim Took II|Thain Isengrim II]], and inherited the title at his father's death in {{SR|1122}}. He had two sons, [[Ferumbras Took II|Ferumbras II]] and [[Bandobras Took|Bandobras]], who moved North to [[Long Cleeve]].<ref name=took>{{App|Took}}</ref>

Isumbras died in {{SR|1159|n}}, the year when the [[Long Winter]] was followed by the [[Days of Dearth]].<ref name=took/><ref>{{App|TA}}</ref><ref>{{FR|Hobbits}}</ref> His son Ferumbras succeeded him to the Thainship.

==Etymology==
"Isumbras" is of French and [[Old English|Anglo-Saxon]] origin and means "iron-arm". It comes from the French ''bras'' meaning "arm", and the Anglo-Saxon and Middle High German word ''[[isen]]'' which means "iron".<ref>[[Jim Allan]], ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of Names"</ref>

==Inspiration==
The name appears in ''[[wikipedia:Sir Isumbras|Sir Isumbras]]'', an English medieval romance about a man who suffers a lifetime of hardship but who finds happiness in his latter years.
